overview: This subject explores the identification, selection and design use of plants in urban landscapes. The content includes an introduction to botanical nomenclature, plant selection, sources of information, planting design, planting plans, the design use of major plant groups, and recognition and identification of representative plants. Case studies of plant use and management in urban landscapes and relevant site visits are also discussed.
ilo: Discuss planting design and plant selection and applications to landscape design;
Recognise, name and describe a selection of landscape plants;
Analyse the design use of plants across different urban landscapes;
Describe methods of preparing planting plans for landscape use;
Discuss issues important in the maintenance and management of plants in urban landscapes.
generic_skills: Report writing for a professional audience;
Literature review and synthesis from a range of sources, including academic journals, online databases, and books;
Critical thinking (problem definition, analysis and synthesis.

Inherent requirements (core participatio.content: Further details on how to seek academic adjustments can be found on the Student Equity and Disability Support website:http://services.unimelb.edu.au/student-equity/home

assessment.brief: Major assignment 2000 words, due end of semester (40%).
Plant materials exam 1, online 50 mins, week 7 (20%)
Plant materials exam 2, online 75 mins, end of semester (30%)

date_times.contact_hours: Total of 47 hours,  including 11 hours lectures and seminars (on campus), 16.5 hours tutorials (on campus), 16.5 hours of practicals (on campus) and a 3 hour field trip (off campus).
